summary: This document is a series of FBI communications and reports concerning an investigation into anonymous online threats made on July 25, 2019, against publicly named victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The FBI requested and deployed an Online Covert Employee (OCE) to identify the poster and assess the threat, and coordinated with foreign authorities regarding a victim residing abroad.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The anonymous threats are directed at victims who have spoken out about abuse committed by him. He is the central figure whose crimes prompted the threats.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Drafted the opening EC, requested the OCE, and is the primary contact for the investigation into the threats against Epstein's victims.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Was present during a telephonic communication where the FBI Special Agent notified a victim's lawyer about the threatening post.

connections.description: The Special Agent is investigating threats made against the victims of Epstein's crimes.
They coordinated in notifying a victim's legal counsel about the threatening online post.

events.title: Anonymous Darknet Threat Post
events.description: An anonymous user on a Darknet forum posted about a planned execution of two of Jeffrey Epstein's publicly named victims. The poster solicited personal information to locate other victims to 'take everyone out.'

events.title: FBI Notification to Victim's Counsel
events.description: FBI Special Agent telephonically communicated the existence of the threatening post to a victim's lawyer, with an Assistant United States Attorney present.

events.title: Online Covert Employee (OCE) Contact Attempt
events.description: OCE #10179, using an online moniker, attempted to contact the anonymous poster on the Darknet forum to gather identifying information and assess the threat.

events.title: FBI Request for OCE Support
events.description: The FBI formally requested the support of Online Covert Employee (OCE) #10179 to engage in limited undercover online cameo appearances to identify the threat poster.

events.title: Information Dissemination to Foreign Authority
events.description: The FBI disseminated information about the threat to a foreign authority (M______), as one threatened victim was a foreign citizen residing abroad and represented by counsel there.

keyFacts: On July 25, 2019, an anonymous poster on the Darknet threatened to execute publicly named victims of Jeffrey Epstein and solicited help to locate and 'take out' all of Epstein's victims.
The FBI opened an investigation and deployed an Online Covert Employee (OCE #10179) to attempt to identify the anonymous poster through undercover online engagements.
The FBI notified a victim's legal counsel of the threat and coordinated with a foreign government because one of the threatened victims was a foreign citizen residing abroad.
The OCE's initial attempt to contact the poster on July 30, 2019, yielded a response directing them to a different platform, but the poster's identity remained unknown.
The documents highlight the immediate and serious risk to the lives of Epstein's victims following his arrest and the public naming of some victims.
